text: <a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-1/" title="Song of Solomon 5:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 I am come into my garden, my sister, *my* spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-2/" title="Song of Solomon 5:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 I sleep, but my heart waketh: *it is* the voice of my beloved that knocketh, *saying*, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew, *and* my locks with the drops of the night.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-3/" title="Song of Solomon 5:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-4/" title="Song of Solomon 5:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 My beloved put in his hand by the hole *of the door*, and my bowels were moved for him.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-5/" title="Song of Solomon 5:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped *with* myrrh, and my fingers *with* sweet smelling myrrh, upon the handles of the lock.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-6/" title="Song of Solomon 5:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself, *and* was gone: my soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-7/" title="Song of Solomon 5:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 The watchmen that went about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-8/" title="Song of Solomon 5:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, that I *am* sick of love.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-9/" title="Song of Solomon 5:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 What *is* thy beloved more than *another* beloved, O thou fairest among women? what *is* thy beloved more than *another* beloved, that thou dost so charge us?
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-10/" title="Song of Solomon 5:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 My beloved *is* white and ruddy, the chiefest among ten thousand.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-11/" title="Song of Solomon 5:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 His head *is as* the most fine gold, his locks *are* bushy, *and* black as a raven.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-12/" title="Song of Solomon 5:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 His eyes *are* as *the eyes* of doves by the rivers of waters, washed with milk, *and* fitly set.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-13/" title="Song of Solomon 5:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 His cheeks *are* as a bed of spices, *as* sweet flowers: his lips *like* lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-14/" title="Song of Solomon 5:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 His hands *are as* gold rings set with the beryl: his belly *is as* bright ivory overlaid *with* sapphires.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-15/" title="Song of Solomon 5:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 His legs *are as* pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: his countenance *is* as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-5-16/" title="Song of Solomon 5:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 His mouth *is* most sweet: yea, he *is* altogether lovely. This *is* my beloved, and this *is* my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.
